boat.name: Zircon
boat.full_description:
Originally priced at £297 when built in 1938, with a Watermote 6 hp engine and prop on the port quarter, 'Zircon' is derived from Harrison Butler's Zyclon design, adapted for class production.

About 50 were built, of which about 25 remained in 2013.
boat.construction_details: Carvel Siberian Larch on Oak galvanised steel floors tabernackle and framing
boat.short_description: 'Zircon' is a 4-tonner, based on a Harrison Butler Zyclon design.

for_sales.sales_text: "Zircon" is a Harrison Butler Z4 tonner, built 1938 by Alfred Lockhart of Brentford, Middlesex, no. 25 of the class. LOA: 22" Beam: 7" Draught: 4" Displacement: 4 Tons. Bermudan sloop rig of tan terylene sails, jib with W-M furling, Yanmar 1GM10 engine, 2 berths, galley, auto-helm, VHF, Simpson Lawrence power winch, covers, warps and fenders, winter legs etc., all included in sale. Removed galvanised pulpit, pushpit and stantions and running backsays are also included.
